trial_identification.studytitle: Effects of aerobic and resistance training on cardiovascular responses of active elderly people
trial_identification.scientifictitle: To evaluate the effects of 12 weeks of aerobic and resistance training, followed by 4 weeks of detraining, on cardiovascular responses of healthy elderly.

conditions.healthcondition: exercise and cardiovascular responses in healthy elderly

conditioncode.conditioncode2: Normal development and function of the cardiovascular system

interventions.interventions: Eleven healthy elderly individuals (both genders, 70+/-5 years) performed a exercise program twice a week for 12 weeks. Each 60 minutes session included 20 minutes of walking at 50-70% of maximal heart rate followed by resistive exercises for lower body muscle groups with level set at 65% of 10 repetition maximum (10-RM) for the first four weeks, 70% for the next four weeks and 75% for the last four weeks. The sessions were administred to 10-15 people group by a physiotherapist and 2 students from the course in physical therapy. The variables were measured before, each 4 weeks during training and 4 weeks after training by 6 minute walk test, blood pressure and heart rate before, immediately after, 5 and 10 minutes after the test.

primaryOutcome.outcome: Blood pressure and heart rate were measured before, immediately after, 5 and 10 minutes after the 6 minute walk test.
primaryOutcome.timepoint: At baseline and at 4, 8 and 12 weeks of training and at 4 weeks of detraining

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Cardio-respiratory performance was evaluated using the 6 minute walk test.
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: At baseline and at 4, 8 and 12 weeks of training and at 4 weeks of detraining

eligibility.inclusivecriteria: Men and women over 60 years of age and in a stable health condition; users of the Brazilian National Health System (SUS); presenting a medical certificate affirming they were able to carry out the proposed exercises; and individuals who had not carried out regular physical activity for more than 1 day a week during the previous 6 weeks, were included.
eligibility.exclusivecriteria: The participants were excluded if they had secondary joint injury or surgery; cardiac illness; cancer; neuropathies; were users of prosthesis; had a systolic blood pressure above 200 mmHg and diastolic blood pressure above 110 mmHg at rest; had any contraindications for exercise; severe functional limitations or cognitive impairment.

trial_design.concealment: This study was an experimental, intentional distribution, uncontrolled clinical trial. The participants were recruited at meetings organized by the Municipal Health secretary of Matinhos-PR, via advertisements on the local radio, and information talks at local community and senior citizen groups. It was asked if the person would like to do exercise or only to be evaluated.

secondarysponsor.sponsorname: Physiotherapy Clinic School of Universidade Federal do Parana

ethicsAndSummary.summary: Aim: Evaluate the effects of the association of resistive and aerobic exercises training on cardiovascular responses in elderly. Methods: Eleven subjects (both genders, 70Â±5 years) performed twice a week walking and resistive exercises for lower body muscle groups for twelve weeks. The variables were measured before; each four weeks during training and four weeks detraining by six minute walk test, blood pressure (BP) and heart rate (HR) before, immediately after, five and 10 minutes after the test.
ethicsAndSummary.publication: Part of this study was presentedd as an abstract in The 19th IAGG Congress of Gerontology and Geriatrics (2009) and XIX Jornada Paranaense de Geriatria e Gerontologia (2009)

ethicscommitee.ethicname: Human Research Ethics Committee of the Federal University of Parana Health Sciences
